sentence.text: Mutations in the human tRNA 3'-terminal camera-type eye development addition gene encoding tRNA nucleotidyltransferase (tRNA-NT), an essential enzyme responsible for addition of the camera-type eye development (cytidine-cytidine-adenosine) sequence to the 3'-termini of tRNAs, have been linked to disease phenotypes including congenital sideroblastic anemia with B-cell immunodeficiency, periodic fevers and developmental delay (SIFD) or retinitis pigmentosa with erythrocyte microcytosis.
